title: Procurement Officer Job at Transsion Holdings
content:
Transsion Holdings is the parent company of TECNO, Infinix, and itel, and a leading smartphone manufacturer in Africa and emerging markets. With a focus on innovation tailored to local needs, Transsion also manages accessory, appliance, and after-sales brands like Oraimo, Syinix, and Carlcare

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented Procurement Officer to manage our company's procurement process and supply chain activities.
	The Procurement Officer will be responsible for sourcing suppliers, negotiating contracts, and managing vendor relationships to ensure timely and cost-effective procurement of goods and services.
	This role requires strong negotiation skills, analytical thinking, and the ability to work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement procurement strategies to optimize sourcing and supplier selection processes.
	Identify potential suppliers, conduct supplier evaluations, and negotiate contracts and pricing terms.
	Manage vendor relationships and monitor supplier performance to ensure compliance with contractual agreements and quality standards.
	Coordinate with internal stakeholders, such as production, finance, and operations, to align procurement activities with business needs.
	Maintain accurate records of procurement transactions, contracts, and vendor information.
	Monitor inventory levels and forecast demand to ensure adequate stock levels while minimizing carrying costs.
	Stay abreast of market trends, industry developments, and regulatory requirements to inform procurement decisions.
	Identify opportunities for cost savings and process improvements within the procurement function.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field.
	3+ years of experience in procurement or supply chain roles.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Required Skills:


	Negotiation skills
	Analytical skills
	Communication
	Organizational skills
	Problem-solving
	Attention to detail
	Knowledge of procurement processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: oyeleke.adebimpe@transsion.com using "Application - procurement officer'' as the subject of the mail.

title: Facility / Logistics Manager Job at DANSOL
content:
At DANSOL, We are set to teach children to depend on the manifold wisdom of God in order to achieve excellence. We believe that the Word of God can and does affect and mold lives. Teachers are expected to be shining examples to the students.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility / Logistics Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Description


	We also seek a highly organised and proactive Facility/Logistics Manager to oversee our school operations.


Key Responsibilities
The Facility/Logistics Manager will be responsible for:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Overseeing and coordinating the cleaning/sanitation, maintenance/repairs, transportation, and security units of the schools.
	Ensuring safety and risk management.
	Managing space allocation and utilisation.
	Ensuring compliance with regulations, codes of conduct, and terms of usage of school facilities.
	Managing and ensuring the sustainability of resources.
	Driving continuous improvement and innovation.
	Handling vendor management and contract administration.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Success in this role will be measured by:
	Facility uptime and availability
	Maintenance backlog and response time
	Energy consumption and cost reduction
	Security and safety levels
	Capital project delivery and budget variance
	Space utilisation and optimisation
	Vendor performance and contract compliance
	Continuous improvement and innovation initiatives.


Qualifications


	A First Degree or HND in any engineering discipline.
	At least 3 years of cognate experience in a similar role.
	Professional Certifications are an added advantage.
	Excellent communication, relational, and emotional skills.
	Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to coordinate teams.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Letter of Application and updated CV to: career@dansolschools.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Junior Analyst Job at Midland Construction and Energy
content:
Midland Construction and Energy (Nig) Ltd began its operations in 2018 as a multifaceted engineering company that elicits perfection in architectural and structural services, and later as a renewable energy service provider. We recognize the importance of electricity to the economic growth of a nation, therefore strive to bridge the energy gap Nigeria and other developing countries are facing by providing clean sustainable energy together with structural projects. We believe this will help to reduce the dependence on the national grid. Our energy services are affordable and reliable, and our experienced and well trained engineers ensure deliverables.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Analyst
Job Locations: Lagos

About the Role


	Midland Construction & Energy is seeking a motivated Junior Analyst with hands-on experience in the energy sector.
	In this role, you will utilize your industry expertise to produce innovative and impactful research tailored to the Nigerian energy market.
	Collaborating with Midland's data, analytics, and product teams, you will play a crucial role in designing data-driven solutions that empower stakeholders across the power industry.
	Our vision is to develop tools that enable organizations to finance, construct, evaluate, and manage energy systems effectively.
	As a Junior Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with a team and influence not only Midland's strategy but also the broader energy landscape in Africa and emerging markets.
	This is an exciting chance to contribute to groundbreaking products that industry professionals rely on.


Key Responsibilities


	Delivering insightful, data-backed analysis and content on power markets, including reports, articles, and videos, to engage and inform Midland’s audience.
	Establishing and nurturing professional relationships within the energy sector, while staying updated on the latest trends and developments.
	Collaborating with cross-functional teams to align Midland’s product development, research, and user engagement initiatives.
	Identifying and analyzing trends in market data to inform strategy and add value to Midland’s goals.


Qualifications


	Graduate or early-career professional with a Degree in Engineering, Physics, Environmental Science, Economics or any related field.
	A minimum of 1 year of experience in the power market, with deep insight into the workings of electricity systems and power trading.
	Familiarity with solar energy and battery technologies is highly desirable.
	Proficiency in data analysis using Python, excel, Power BI, with a demonstrated ability to interpret and present complex datasets.
	Strong analytical and quantitative skills, enabling you to uncover trends and share valuable insights.
	Exceptional critical thinking, combined with the ability to ask thought-provoking questions and develop innovative approaches.


Desirable Skills:


	Strong written communication abilities, with a talent for simplifying complex ideas into accessible, clear language.
	Experience producing high-quality content that resonates with a professional audience.


Why Join Midland


	This role offers a platform to influence Midland’s future direction while becoming a recognized thought leader in the energy industry.
	You’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of energy systems, all while collaborating with a passionate and innovative team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: operations@midlandafrica.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Head of Marketing Job at De Koolar Nigeria Limited
content:
De Koolar Nigeria Limited is a 100% owned indigenous HVAC Company with over two decades of industry experience. We are leading Nigerian manufacturers and suppliers of a range of Ice Block Making Machine, Cold room, Blast Freezer, Display Chiller Fridge, Industrial Ovens, Refrigerators and Air Conditioners, among other domestic and industrial heat transfer equipment. Our services include all aspects of design, installation, maintenance and repairs of domestic, commercial and industrial systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Marketing

Job Location: Agege, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Head of Marketing will be responsible for the strategic development, implementation, and oversight of De Koolar’s national marketing, sales, and customer engagement efforts.
	This role will drive business growth through demand generation, strategic brand positioning, and performance marketing while leading a cross-functional team across physical and digital channels.
	The ideal candidate must be an experienced marketing leader with a proven track record in selling physical engineering/manufactured products, leading distributed teams, and using data to drive decisions.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Marketing & Business Growth:


	Design and execute a national marketing and sales strategy that drives revenue, brand visibility, and market expansion.
	Identify and pursue market opportunities in new sectors and geographies, including agriculture, logistics, healthcare, and FMCGs.
	Develop annual marketing plans and sales forecasts aligned with corporate goals and expansion targets.
	Monitor competitor activities, market trends, and customer feedback to proactively adjust strategies.


Leadership & Team Management:


	Lead and manage the Business Development Executives and Officers across all regional offices (North, South-West, South-East, etc.).
	Supervise and align the efforts of the Digital Marketing and Customer Relationship teams to ensure integrated customer outreach.
	Build and maintain a high-performance marketing department through clear KPIs, regular coaching, and team development.


Brand & Digital Strategy:


	Oversee the company’s online presence across all platforms – website, SEO/SEM, social media, paid ads, and email marketing.
	Champion the storytelling and brand positioning strategy of De Koolar as a leading innovator in cold storage and engineering solutions.
	Collaborate with content creators, designers, and IT to ensure messaging consistency across digital and offline channels.


Customer Relationship Management:


	Ensure the ERP/CRM system is effectively utilized to track leads, conversions, customer communications, and satisfaction.
	Guarantee the accuracy and daily reporting of customer data and insights across all channels and branches.
	Design programs for customer retention, referral programs, and after-sales engagement.


Sales Enablement:


	Serve as the Lead Corporate Sales Executive responsible for initiating and closing high-value B2B deals with corporate clients, distributors, government bodies, and institutions.
	Personally manage and grow strategic accounts, ensuring long-term client satisfaction and repeat business.
	Work hands-on with the Business Development Executives, Officers, Digital Marketers, and Customer Relationship Officers — all of whom are involved in direct sales — to coordinate sales activities across physical and digital channels.
	Design and deliver training, pitch tools, sales scripts, and customer engagement strategies to equip all front-line sales staff for performance excellence.
	Provide senior-level oversight of major project quotations, contract negotiations, and deal finalization.
	Monitor and report weekly/monthly sales performance across branches and product lines.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Monthly and quarterly sales target achievement by region and product.
	Number and value of corporate B2B deals closed.
	Growth in qualified leads generated (offline and digital).
	Customer satisfaction and retention scores.
	Accuracy and timeliness of CRM data reporting.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Engineering, Business Administration, or related field (Engineering/Technical background is a strong plus).
	5-8 years of progressive experience in marketing, preferably in manufacturing, engineering, or B2B sectors.
	Proven experience leading a national marketing or sales team with measurable results.
	Strong grasp of traditional and digital marketing tools, CRM platforms, and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, ERP Dashboard, Google Ads, SEO & Display).
	Excellent leadership, communication, and people management skills.
	High integrity, result-oriented mindset, attention to detail, and a drive to break barriers.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@dekoolar.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.
